protein.specific_function: Catalyzes the initial step in utilization of glucose by the beta-cell and liver at physiological glucose concentration. Glucokinase has a high Km for glucose, and so it is effective only when glucose is abundant. The role of GCK is to provide G6P for the synthesis of glycogen. Pancreatic glucokinase plays an important role in modulating insulin secretion. Hepatic glucokinase helps to facilitate the uptake and conversion of glucose by acting as an insulin-sensitive determinant of hepatic glucose usage.

pathway.name: Amino sugar and nucleotide sugar metabolism
Maturity onset diabetes of the young

go_class.description: phosphotransferase activity, alcohol group as acceptor
elevation of cytosolic calcium ion concentration
positive regulation of glycogen biosynthetic process
